Model.Playground

Class AbstractPlayground

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Playground.AbstractPlayground
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPlayground
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EnemyPlayground, OwnPlayground

    public abstract class AbstractPlayground
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPlayground
    The playground is implemented as a IDrawable[][] Array. IDrawable Objects can be Water, ShotWater and ShipPart Every Player got his own playground with his ships and an enemy playground

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected IDrawable[][] Field 
      protected boolean gameLost 
      static java.util.logging.Logger logAbstractPlayground 
      protected int playgroundsize 
      protected int shipsplaced 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractPlayground() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void buildPlayground()
      This method builds the Playground, if there are no Ships in the ShipList, it will create an playground filled all Fields with water If there are Ships in the List it will place them as shipParts Creates the Playground, sets all ships-parts on the Field (if it is the own Field) and fills the rest of the fields with water
      void drawPlayground()
      Restriction: You can only draw the Playground if it is built Draws all Fields of the Playground
      void resetAll()
      Sets all Field in the Drawable Field[][] to null sets the Amount of Ships placed in the Playground to 0 After the Playground is reset, it needs to be instantiated and build again
      abstract void setLabels(java.lang.Object[] labelArray)
      Restriction: You can only set the Labels to the Objects in the Playground, when it is build Connects all Drawable Objects of the selected Playground with an Label shown at the GUI

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • buildPlayground

        public abstract void buildPlayground()
        Description copied from interface: IPlayground
        This method builds the Playground, if there are no Ships in the ShipList, it will create an playground filled all Fields with water If there are Ships in the List it will place them as shipParts Creates the Playground, sets all ships-parts on the Field (if it is the own Field) and fills the rest of the fields with water
